definition: (interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: If I will fail to pass TOEFL, please remember to buy me a Haagen-Dazs.
sentences.chinese: 如果我過不了TOEFL，記得要買哈根達斯給我喫。

sentences.english: Häagen Dazs Jingui implement its strategy.
sentences.chinese: 哈根達斯貫徹了其矜貴策略。

sentences.english: He brought me home my very own pint of Häagen-Dazs coffee ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫給我帶回來我最喜歡的哈根達斯咖啡冰激凌。

sentences.english: Haagen test is that large glass of the "white elephant" problem?
sentences.chinese: 哈根達斯測試的是，大型玻璃的“白象”問題？

sentences.english: Description: Who ever thought Haagen-Dazs would make it into this article?
sentences.chinese: 誰能想到哈根達斯居然可以寫進這篇文章？

sentences.english: The most popular in recent years have been Haagen-Dazs' ice cream mooncakes.
sentences.chinese: 近年來最流行的就是哈根達斯德冰激凌月餅了。

sentences.english: Haagen-Dazs ice cream had its competitors licked.
sentences.chinese: 哈根達斯冰淇淋讓競爭對手望塵莫及。

sentences.english: I gave away a brand new pint of Häagen-Dazs.
sentences.chinese: 我放棄了新一品脫的哈根達斯。

definition: fried chicken pieces with salt and pepper/Taiwan-style fried chicken
rice in gravy, typically with meat and vegetables
soft candy (gummi candy, gumdrop, jellybean etc)
brand of Hong Kong instant noodles/also used as term for instant noodles in general
buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
hot pot containing stinky tofu and other ingredients (Taiwanese dish)
